title: Hop-Spanners for Geometric Intersection Graphs Research supported in part by NSF award DMS-0701280 and the Summer Scholars Program at Tufts University.
abstract:
Abstract
A t𝑡t-spanner of a graph G=(V,E)𝐺𝑉𝐸G=(V,E) is a subgraph H=(V,E′)𝐻𝑉superscript𝐸′H=(V,E^{\prime}) that contains a u​v𝑢𝑣uv-path of length at most t𝑡t for every u​v∈E𝑢𝑣𝐸uv\in E. It is known that every n𝑛n-vertex graph admits a (2​k−1)2𝑘1(2k-1)-spanner with O​(n1+1/k)𝑂superscript𝑛11𝑘O(n^{1+1/k}) edges for k≥1𝑘1k\geq 1. This bound is the best possible for 1≤k≤91𝑘91\leq k\leq 9 and is conjectured to be optimal due to Erdős’ girth conjecture.
We study t𝑡t-spanners for t∈{2,3}𝑡23t\in\{2,3\} for geometric intersection graphs in the plane. These spanners are also known as t𝑡t-hop spanners to emphasize the use of graph-theoretic distances (as opposed to Euclidean distances between the geometric objects or their centers). We obtain the following results:
(1) Every n𝑛n-vertex unit disk graph (UDG) admits a 2-hop spanner with O​(n)𝑂𝑛O(n) edges; improving upon the previous bound of O​(n​log⁡n)𝑂𝑛𝑛O(n\log n).
(2) The intersection graph of n𝑛n axis-aligned fat rectangles admits a 2-hop spanner with O​(n​log⁡n)𝑂𝑛𝑛O(n\log n) edges, and this bound is tight up to a factor of log⁡log⁡n𝑛\log\log n.
(3) The intersection graph of n𝑛n fat convex bodies in the plane admits a 3-hop spanner with O​(n​log⁡n)𝑂𝑛𝑛O(n\log n) edges.
(4) The intersection graph of n𝑛n axis-aligned rectangles admits a 3-hop spanner with O​(n​log2⁡n)𝑂𝑛superscript2𝑛O(n\log^{2}n) edges.
